result.execSummary:
The defendant Riley John Steinhauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Riley John Steinhauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Riley John Steinhauer was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant must report to Probation within 72 hours of release from custody.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Minot. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Riley John Steinhauer appeared via video-conferencing from Atty Harrelson's laptop. Case called 1:04 pm. Atty Hartung makes statement. Atty Harrelson responds. ADA Hartung amends Count 1 to Misdeameanor. Court amends to 943.50(1m)(b).  Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count one. Court dismisses Count #2. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court orders: 1 year probation w/h with conditions - 
- Court Costs $243.00
- Restituion $594.96. To be joint and several with 14CF526
- Cooperate with law enforcement
- No contact with Walmart or B. Pappe. 
- Complete all program deemed appropiate by the COMPAS or by Probation
- Bond will continue until Defendant reports to Probation
- Must report to probation within 72 hours released from custody
- Probation may be transfered to MN
Filed by Atty Harrelson. Re: plea and sentencing hearing. km

filed by Aarah Saugen w/DOC - stating Defendant is in custody in Goodhue County and serving a jail term (Release 8/17/15). eif        w/file to RMW

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
